text: Hi everyone Happy Teusday!
I have an issue.
Has anyone used the groupby() filter for anything other that default HubSpot blog variables?
<@U38EZFVFE|chadbluleadz> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/chadbluleadz/F4X11L5PA/my_HubSpot_grouped_loop.txt|My HubSpot Grouped Loop> and commented: line 5 nd 6 get errors
<!here|@here>
I don’t think widgets.places.body.value should be in quotes
it has to be.
I think <@U22PJPGK0> is right here, you want to reference the value of the widget right?
Otherwise you’re just saying ‘widgets.places.body.value’ is the groupby parameter (as a string)
Also did you export_to_template_context the module? IDK if that makes a difference in this use case (since everything shoudl live in the widgets dict regardless) but worth a try
Oh… I see, you’re matching on them having the places widget have the same value
Try chopping out .body.value
yeah I tried that.

<@U38EZFVFE|chadbluleadz> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/chadbluleadz/F4XRK617W/-.txt|Untitled> and commented: You would think that leaving the quotes would make it a string but in this case it doesnt. The same thing applies to sort.
BTW this snippet does work perfectly
for some reason I am getting an error with groupby
<@U38EZFVFE|chadbluleadz> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/chadbluleadz/F4XT4NCTF/screen_shot_2017-04-11_at_2.44.09_pm.jpg|groupby Issue>
could be that groupby only applies to top-level attributes?
odd that sort works fine for it
What is it you’re trying to accomplish? just a list of specific people with a certain state attribute
Testimonials from certain states grouped together.
Found Out From HubSpot Dev Team that it isnt possible to read a custom attribute with groupby()
